p: Mosquitoes of the Culicidae family are considered the most dangerous animals on earth due to their capacity to transmit diseases and their medical importance regarding viruses, protozoa, and nematode transmission ( 1). According to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) vector-borne diseases are considered public health problems and have a major social and economic impact causing high morbidity and mortality, especially in developing countries ( 2). Approximately 75% of the Latin American population lives in cities, which makes the most urbanized continent in the world ( 3). The magnitude of climate and ecosystem changes and disorderly occupation of urban areas may increase the vulnerability of human populations to infectious disease transmission ( 2). Moreover, these changes have led several vectors to adapt to the urban environment ( 4, 5). We list the top 15 pathogens transmitted by Culicidae in the Americas and the prevalence of viruses is evident (80%), all considered as arboviruses ( Table 1). Aedes genus has drawn the attention of the world health authorities due to the severity of diseases transmitted in the last 10 years, especially Dengue, Chikungunya, and Zika fevers.
